newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF says to deal sternly with Nomura after probe.
newsitem.headline: MOF says to deal sternly with Nomura after probe.

text.p: Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka told reporters on Tuesday that his ministry would deal sternly with Nomura Securities Co Ltd if investigations confirm it violated securities laws.
"The Finance Ministry will take stern measures against Nomura after the Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission (SESC) reports to the ministry about the results of its probe," he said.
He also said it was "extremely regrettable" if Nomura had again violated securities laws.
His remarks followed a raid on Nomura's main offices and 10 other unspecified locations by prosecutors and officials from the nation's securities watchdog.
The SESC has been probing Nomura over its March 6 admission that two of its directors made discretionary deals banned under Japanese law and funnelled profits to a corporate client.
Mitsuzuka said he believes the prosecutors and the SESC will conduct a prudent investigation into the incident.
